p.5: The Real-Time Security Services Infrastructure team at one of our largest Fortune 100 Energy clients, headquartered in Baltimore, MD, is actively seeking an IT Analyst focused on two large enterprise-wide projects at the utility-level. These projects will focus on remote support of real-time commutations equipment, control room display boards and operator consoles, backups for virtual and physical systems, technical compliance documentation, and change coordination across Midwest and Mid-Atlantic data centers and control rooms.
p.7: As an IT Analyst you will be responsible for the maintenance & installation of the company's software & hardware solutions. This includes configuring and building full stack IT systems, while working under guidance from Senior Technicians on designs and implementations. If you are interested in learning more, we encourage to you apply!

li: 0-3 yrs. of experience with Telecommunications, Networking, Engineering or related field.
li.1: Bachelor=E2=80=99s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, etc. or equivalent experience.
li.2: Knowledge or experience working with servicers and virtualization tools (i.e., VMware).
li.3: Surface-level knowledge or experience working with backup & storage technologies (NetApp is a plus!)
li.4: Knowledge or experience with Network Access Controls, RTU=E2=80=99s, and/or terminals/circuits.
li.5: Any experience with Unix/Linux is a plus!
li.6: Willingness to learn the above technologies and get exposure to hands-on experience from a tenured Real-Time technical team.

li: Provide virtualization support, specifically with VMware backup tool, to copy and prevent loss of data.
li.1: Building, configuring & supporting the integration of a full stack of IT systems/resources that include but are not limited to:
li.2: Active Directory, Security Information & Event Monitoring system (SIEM), end-point protection, network access control (NAC), and IP address management
li.3: Assisting and coordinating the integration of the above systems with the OSI system.
li.4: Building and deploying workstations and other equipment to various sites/control systems.

p.14: A welcoming, team environment where you will be provided an opportunity to work with a Fortune 100 company.
